intro: Cyclogramma chunii, commonly known as the Chinese cyclogramma, is a species of flowering plant in the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to China and is characterized by its small, trifoliate leaves and yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in dry, open habitats. Cyclogramma chunii is known for its ability to fix atmospheric nitrogen, which contributes to soil fertility. It is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
